website_summaries.verdict: Hikers who constantly seek support and comfort in a low-cut shoe may find satisfaction in the versatile Vasque Mantra 2.0 GTX (the waterproof variant of the Mantra 2.0). It was, however, lambasted for its faulty width and questionable traction on smooth grounds. By and large, the Vasque Mantra 2.0 GTX may have earned negative remarks that tarnish its name, but its good points still give outdoor lovers reasons to check it out.
pros: Numerous hikers stated that they did not experience any issues with its waterproofing
Hordes of users were delighted with the comfort delivered by the Vasque Mantra 2.0 GTX
Surprisingly, this pair rendered tons of ankle support, according to umpteen wearers
Some online buyers mentioned how impressed they were with the quality of the materials used in this day hiking shoe
The versatility of the Mantra 2.0 GTX from Vasque was praised by plenty of verified purchasers
cons: Many owners testified to its poor grip on wet and slick surfaces
Heaps of users said that it had a restrictive fit
More than a handful did not recommend using the Vasque Mantra 2.0 GTX during summer hikes as it gets too warm

customer_reviews.title: and they feel great. I need to wear an orthotic insole under ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my trip to Ireland in September. I have put them on a couple times to check the fit, and they feel great. I need to wear an orthotic insole under the shoe's cushion insole, and I was happy to see that this shoe's insole completely covers my orthotic, so I can rest assured I will be able to walk with no pain from the orthotic edge cutting into the bottom of my feet. Very nice looking shoe. I got the water-proof version since we'll be doing a lot of hiking most likely in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S.

customer_reviews.title: Vasque comes through once again!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Vasque girl. I've owned the original Sundowner when Vasque was making them in Italy. It was a sad day in Vasque history when they decided to move mfg to China. But anyway, this boot is comfortable, and kept my feet warm and dry during a 3 week trip to Ireland in September. Hiking in Ireland is wet, muddy, and slippery, and these boots were the best defense against all of those elements. The Vibram sole is outstanding and the Gortex let me walk proudly through muddy puddles. Vasque boots have a tendency to run a little snug so I bought a size larger and wear them with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: mountain girl

customer_reviews.title: I do like the look of the shoe but very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before buying these shoes and everyone “loves” them. I think they run somewhat small, the toe area is extremely hard and there is no cushion in the shoe. I do like the look of the shoe but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoes I've worn
customer_reviews.text: I've worn different brands of hiking shoes but these are the best. I've gone through several pairs. Roomy in toe box. Sturdy soles. My feet never hurt wearing these. Definitely waterproof. Fit true to size, or you could get 1/2 size larger if you wear thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly in Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: The only shoes you need
customer_reviews.text: If I could only have one pair of shoes in this world, it would be this pair. I know whereof I speak--- these are the fifth pair I have bought. They fit wonderfully well and give my feet, knees, and back proper alighnment and support. They go the Louvre as well as to the Giant Sequoia National Monument. They do such a great job that I even sneak them under the long, black, formal gown my choir wears for concerts. Now those hours on the risers are no problem at all. Did I say I am 74?? Buy these shoes. You will NOT be sorry!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jules 45

customer_reviews.title: Premium in all respects.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all the way around. The size fits as expected, comfort is premium, support is absolutely solid, construction is tight, material breathes well, waterproofing is far more than most people will ever need, fit, and finish are premium. If you are wearing athletic shoes for daily walking about do your self a huge favor, grab these, and you will never look back.
customer_reviews.author: Strontium90

customer_reviews.title: vasque woman mantra 2.0 gtx hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these hiking shoes. I found that the size was fine, but the arch felt too big for my feet or was placed a bit differently-- so I "felt" the arch. I also decided I wanted a pair of hiking shoes that were even more light weight than these. I liked that these were study and waterproof. I think they would have lasted a long time-- just weren't built for the shape of my feet. Compared to my 10 year old pair of hiking shoes that I replaced, these were very light weight :-). They didn't rub or anything and could have worn them on a hike right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: fits and wears right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have a great deal of trouble finding shows that fit. these I ordered 1/2 size larger then my normal shoe and they fit great Also we have a small orchard and i walk 15 thousand to 25 thousand steps a day. most shoes are very uncomfortable out of the box Not these able to ware them all day. yes that are somewhat hot being gore tex but I need a waterproof shoe and these fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: Helen Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of the Mantra & I have to say the reviews are correct that say they're broken in right out of the box. It took a little time with my 1st pair I bought several years ago but this time they were comfortable enough for me to wear for hours the first day I put them on. I work weekends on a farm & not only walk alot but also on some rough & uneven terrain. I'm also on my feet for most of the day. These are great for trucking through anything & my feet feel fine. I also have bunions & the wider toe box makes them comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Well made!!  Very comfortable on first wear!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable on first try! Great toe room! I have high arches, wear size 9N in dress shoe-- however, I find I need a size 10M for hiking shoes/boots. I also have a pair of Vasque hiking boots --- same size; again, very well made and a great fit -- one of the most comfortable hiking boots I have ever worn! Expecting/suspecting same with my new hiking shoes! Yes, I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Happy ceet
customer_reviews.text: I am a landscaper and having protected feet is essential in my line of work. Vasque funs a half inch small so this time I ordered a size 9. Love the shoes, extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept a different color
customer_reviews.text: Vasque is a wonderful brand for my narrow foot and especially for my very narrow heel. The only reason for the return is because I kept a different color of Vasque.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: A great deal at $60
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these before from Redwing Shoes and loved them, so when I saw this extremely low price on Amazon, I jumped on it. The weird thing is, this new pair doesn't fit quite the same, and there's a strange little 'pop' of the leather every time my foot flexes with a step. Not enough to return them, though. Vasques are so far the only hiking shoe/boot for me with my bad feet and orthotics - and no break-in time is needed. So, Go Vasque!
customer_reviews.author: Book Lady

customer_reviews.title: Thought they'd fit better and be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought they weren't that comfortable and my toes felt tender after several hours of wear, even though we weren't doing serious hiking.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerX

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Love these hiking boots! They run pretty true to size to slightly roomy, but since I wear thicker socks while hiking it wasn't a issue. My feet didn't move around inside the shoe while going up steep inclines/declines, and they were well insulated even hiking in below freezing temps (again, thick socks). Walked through some icy/snowy patches and had no problems with waterproofing and had very good traction. Overall one of the best shoe purchases I've ever made. Just make sure they fit your feet comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Lee

customer_reviews.title: Forget arch support!
customer_reviews.text: Not good arch support like I need. Sent them back. The Vasque Trailbender sneaker is the best shoe I have ever worn, and this one fell short of the same comfort and support.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Runs very large
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when I received my shoes as I have had numerous Vasque hiking shoes and boots over the years and have never had a problem with size. I ordered an 8.5 and they were at least 2 sizes too large. I held them up to my current Vasque 8.5s and they were a 1/2" longer. I also do not like the new lacing design, although it's possible over time that I would come to appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Kept my feet dry after a rainy week of hiking and puddle jumping on Kauai. I have trouble fitting shoes to my bunion - developed a slight pinch after a week of wear but I softened the spot with some leather conditioner and that seems to help. My only complaint is the heel collar is rather large for a women's boot - but my heel stays put so I try to ignore that. If your hiking in scree or sand I would expect a lot of debris in boot.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Bennet

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I can find.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes fit just right in the right places.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Not wide toe box...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return them. They are just not wide enough. They are wider at the ball of the foot, but then come down narrower at the toes. My feet are wide from the ball all the way to the tip of my toes. I need a wide toe box. These do not have that.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Allen

customer_reviews.title: Shoes rhat are REALLY made for walking
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t worn them enough but so far they’re not heavy, feet breath well, nice support and don’t have to worry about how clean they look
customer_reviews.author: sabrina villaseñor

customer_reviews.title: This gtx version pinches in around te ankle and heel ...
customer_reviews.text: This gtx version pinches in around te ankle and heel collar at certain points. It may loosen up eventually, but I returned them. I got the regular version and they fit perfectly to size. My shoe size is 8.5 medium, as measured in REI.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my feet and toes. I haven't worn these shoes all day as yet, but I suspect I will be able to wear they comfortable 4 to 6 hours based on the time I have already worn them. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lialexgma

customer_reviews.title: Stiff
customer_reviews.text: If you like stiff than this is the shoe for you...runs small and no support. I was disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Terri S

customer_reviews.title: Sole is harder then expected
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, the sole is harder then I expected and after walking a mile, the firm sole was causing some pain in the feet. So I am going to try and find some softer insoles, to see if that helps. For the price I paid I shouldn't have to do this. With all my other orders that I have made with Amazon I have always been pleased with their prompt deliveries but this time I was dissappointed in how long Amazon took to have my ordered delivered.. Yes I choose free shipping, but they took two weeks to get delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Baskett

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Having owned 2 pairs of Vasque Mantra boots, I purchased my 3rd pair in March 2017. Within the first 100 miles of use, the toe in each boot became separated from the sole. I wish to have them replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are tough, well made shoes. The ability to get them in a wide width is great as I had tried a size up in the regular width and it was predictably an extra length to trip over! The tread lugs are substantial and I'm thinking these will last 4 years of heavy use like my last pair of Vasque's did.
customer_reviews.author: Merrie

customer_reviews.title: Hooray for Vasque hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Hooray for Vasque hiking shoes. I wear my originals everyday in the forest for an hour's hike. Great shoe. Lasted about a year and a half after heavy daily use. Interior wore out but the sole is still great. These new ones are just a little stiff at first. They will slowly replace my first pair. Nice waterproofing for those sometimes sloshy hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Valentino

customer_reviews.title: Love these hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these hiking shoes for many years. I’ve worn through about 5 pairs. I’m so thankful they are still making them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: 0 hiking shoes and I love them. Very comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Vasque Mantra 2.0 hiking shoes and I love them. Very comfortable right out of the box. I have a narrow heel and have trouble finding hiking boots that I don't slip out of and these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymoose

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these both for short day hikes and multi-day section hikes on the Appalachian Trail, and everything in between. These are holding up well and are comfortable for my feet. My only complaint is they aren't great for downhill hiking. My feet slip a bit in the shoe and press my toes into the front. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jena H.

customer_reviews.title: Will order again!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the insole with a better hi arch support. I would order these shoes again but in the next size larger. They look terrific on my feet while I garden all day! Light weight, keep my feet dry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful shoe except that the top barely laces together over my high instep unless I am wearing a rather thin pair of socks.
customer_reviews.author: keeting

customer_reviews.title: Vasque is a great boot/shoe manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy hiking shoe. Good fit and easy to brush clean.
customer_reviews.author: TravelTheWorld

customer_reviews.title: Good boots.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of these boots. They are comfortable for hikes on glaciers or the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Traction is great. At first I was concerned they were too ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Vasque boots before. This is my first pair of shoes. Traction is great. At first I was concerned they were too stiff to be comfortable, but I wore them all day without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: debg

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Women's Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of the Vasque Mantra 2.0, but were too small for this season's hiking. Love these as much as the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Oma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for hiking and the only ones I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes for hiking and the only ones I can wear that do not irritate my Achilles tendons. I've had both Achilles tendons repaired and haglunfs bumps removed twice on each foot. Highly recommended for anyone with similar condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality support.
customer_reviews.text: Good support for my flat feet, with the New Balance inserts. Good on mountain town sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Brundige

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand and when I need another pair I ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the same cushion I am used to from this brand under the balls of my feet. I added gel inserts and still wish there was more. However, I love this brand and when I need another pair I will stick with Vasque but not the Mantra.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Yeager

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second pair from Amazon...
customer_reviews.text: once I found them in a store and liked them so much. I do need an orthotic insert required by my doctor but I don't have to take out the insert to put it in. Size 10 was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Connell

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves them
customer_reviews.text: They are elegant, if this is possible for a hiking shoe, and she uses them in tropical rainy days to go to work. They provide waterproof and secure grip.
customer_reviews.author: Pep

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes/boots
customer_reviews.text: Have had these before and used them for hiking etc. Great shoes, all as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable straight out of the box. Size is very consistent from one model to the next.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made shoe
customer_reviews.text: I read that these ran narrow, but they were much too wide for my 3A or 4A feet. It is very hard to find good boots for narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamwalker99

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great! Feel awesome right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! Feel awesome right out of the box. I've worn them every day for a week now, and I still have no complaints. They handle wet trails like a champ, and keep my feet warm and dry. And they do equally well on pavement and inside floors. I would recommend them for anyone lookin for a high quality good all around shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sears

customer_reviews.title: Too Big for Me
customer_reviews.text: Too long and stiff. Heavy. Well made, but fit all wrong for me. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Megan G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hiking boots. Was a little cautions about buying boots online, but I have been very happy with them. Comfortable and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A terrific hiking/ walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: A terrific hiking/ walking shoe. It fits quite comfortably as did my last pair of Vasqe hikers which finally gave up the ghost after 10 years!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S Smith

customer_reviews.title: Can’t trust Vasque sizing any more!
customer_reviews.text: This product is running small now. I missed the return window. I am very disappointed with Vasque as I have been a loyal customer and feel this shoe won’t meet my needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe that needs better sole cushions.
customer_reviews.text: Qualitymade shoe, but go with a better sole cushion if doing distances.
customer_reviews.author: mmj

customer_reviews.title: Careful on sizing...
customer_reviews.text: The boot seems great, but it was definitely too small. Width was as advertised, however. Had to return it. I'm giving five stars because it would have been a keeper with the right sizing.
customer_reviews.author: R McR

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I love them. They are comfortable and are good for walking on winter streets. I think they are quite stylish from a sporty point of view, and the price is reasonable too.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J. Pfahler

customer_reviews.title: I like them. The high could be higher as I ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them. The high could be higher as I have a high arch. But they are comfortable and waterproof, so I like them.
customer_reviews.author: gloria menendez

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised that the size I ordered was much too ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised that the size I ordered was much too long. It fits well around the heel but I felt I had an extra inch too much in the front of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Pitou

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable! My husband owns a pair for work, he raved about em, so I had to have a pair. I am having a total knee replacement so I was searching for a high quality, light weight shoe. This was the one.
customer_reviews.author: J Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable after several hours of break-in time
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable after several hours of break-in time...the stitching and material at base of lace area is puckered...other than that, a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: holly b. mansager

customer_reviews.title: I already had one pair of these. I need ...
customer_reviews.text: I already had one pair of these. I need room in the toes and these are wide enough in medium while still fitting the heel. I take a 7.5 in some shoes but an 8 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Don789

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wore the last pair for seven years. I hope to get as many out of this pair
customer_reviews.author: CBN

customer_reviews.title: 5 I just received it yesterday it seem to fit much better but I have not used it yet
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them very much yet but I noticed the sole are not as cushiony as my first Vasque, how this would affect my feet if I were to walk for long hours I am not sure yet as I have used it only so far for a 20 minutes walk.
customer_reviews.author: Felisa De los Santos

customer_reviews.title: Nice roomy toe box
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. This time I got the Gortex version. Nice roomy toe box. Good support.
customer_reviews.author: Betho

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They were waterproof in rainy Ireland. My first pair was grey. I'm liking the rich brown.
customer_reviews.author: JEK

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: I was having a difficult time finding a shoe that fits....these were great! I have enjoyed hiking in them. Fast shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sigler

customer_reviews.title: Way too big!
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of Vasque hiking boots in a size 5.5 which fit well. However, the Mantra 2.0 GTX hiking shoe in a size 5.5 is gigantic. It was easily one full size too big for my feet. Since these do not come in a size 4.5, so I'll have to search for another boot.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes ever! I work in agriculture and they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Too tight against widest part of foot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a full size bigger than my shoes size as suggested. Still across the widest part of the foot it was too tight. It has been a week since I did a short hour long hike and my foot is still in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Walking without pain
customer_reviews.text: Finally a shoe that feels good! I have a lot of metal in my right foot and a wicked bunion on the left foot. I also have advanced arthritis. These are the first shoes (and I have tried hundreds) that allow me to walk without pain. Please don't ever change this style.
customer_reviews.author: Sky watcher

customer_reviews.title: excellent trekking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she was very happy with it. We did about 20 walks on New Zealand south island on moutain rocks, snow, farmland, through streams and on slippery seaside rocks. They've worn very little, the vibram sole has good grip and the goretex kept her feet dry. Good price also.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Navaratnam

customer_reviews.title: But they feel good. Will be trying something more challenging in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn them in the house and on one 3 miles flat hike. But they feel good. Will be trying something more challenging in the coming days. So far, I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: lynda katonak

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm posting this for my wife. These shoes were returned. She ended up with Clarks Women's Wave Trek Lace-Up. Better fit and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Azoic

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think that I would have really liked the shoe in the correct size. My shoe was too small.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Scott

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Read article in paper so I thought I would try it out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vasque womens Mantra 2.0 GTX-W Mantra 2.0 Gtx-w
product_meta.description: The Mantra 2.0 utilizes a molded polyurethane midsole which is very unique in a low shoe. The leather upper provides additional rigidity and support, not to mention protection from the sometimes evil inconsistencies of the trail. Keeping true to its higher-end feature set, the Mantra 2.0 is also available with a Gore-Tex lining. GORE-TEX is the ultimate system for durable waterproofing and breathable comfort. Vibram rubber compounds deliver superior grip, traction and durability.
